DwdNearNeighbor module

class DwdNearNeighbor.NearNeighbor(x_active, y_active, z_active, zip_data_active, k_factor, start_date, end_date, activ_id, station_list)[source]

Bases: object

Description

This class is finding near neighbors for the location you choosed and creates all the needed data as a DataFrame

__init__(x_active, y_active, z_active, zip_data_active, k_factor, start_date, end_date, activ_id, station_list)[source]
Parameters

  • x_active – x-coordinates (geoLaenge): as array. Should be set from DwdDataPrep.data_prep_for_new_location()

  • y_active – y-coordinates (geoBreite): as array. Should be set from DwdDataPrep.data_prep_for_new_location()

  • z_active – z-coordinates (Stationshoehe): as array. Should be set from DwdDataPrep.data_prep_for_new_location()

  • zip_data_active – as array. Zipped x-coordinates and y-coordinates.

  • k_factor – as int. How many stations you want to find around your coordinates?

  • start_date – as int. –> YYYYMMDDHHMM

  • end_date – as int. –> YYYYMMDDHHMM

  • activ_id – as list. All the activ stations in timedelta

  • station_list – as dict. All the stations as an object in a dictionary

average_for_coordinate(data_looking_for='TT_10', qn_weight_n_avg=False, distance_weight_n_avg=False, qn_distance_weight_n_avg=False, compare_n_avg=False, compare_station=None)[source]
Description

Is calculation different variants.

Param

data_looking_for=”TT_10”: as string. Check Dwd.Dict title_dict or unit_dict.

Param

qn_weight_n_avg=False: as Boolean. If True weight the quality of data.

Param

distance_weight_n_avg=False: as Boolean. If True weight the distance of data.

Param

qn_distance_weight_n_avg=False (not needed for now, maybe in future): as Boolean.

Param

compare_n_avg=False: as Boolean. If you want to compare, how accurate your methods are, set True and choose coordinates for a station.

Param

compare_station=None: as string. If compare_n_avg==True set this as the name of a station with the right prefix

Returns

if compare_n_avg==True: data_all (as DataFrame), data_mean (as DataFrame), index_for_plot (as list), column_name_list (as list), data_to_compare (as DataFrame), diff (as DataFrame), maximum (as int), avg_diff (as array)

Returns

if compare_n_avg==False: data_all (as DataFrame), data_mean (as DataFrame), index_for_plot (as list), column_name_list (as list)

dataframe_near_from_to()[source]
Description

Is generating a DataFrame with alle the dates inside your files (timedelta for every file) inside your timedelta. Also returning same lists from self.datapath_near()

Returns

df_from_to, datapath_near_list, column_names_list, column_name_list: as list, df_from_to as DataFrame

dataframe_near_from_to_path()[source]
Description

Is connecting df_from_to with datapah_near_list for easier handling.

Returns

df_from_to, column_names_list, column_name_list: as list, df_from_to as DataFrame

datapath_near()[source]
Description

Is getting all the paths for data of all the near stations in timedelta. Also creating a list with the columnnames for your DataFrame

Returns

datapath_near_list, column_names_list, column_name_list: all as list

date_range_df()[source]
Description

Is generating an empty DataFrame for timedelta. If you want to change the resolution to 1 minute, you should make some changes here

Returns

date_range_df: as DataFrame

find_near()[source]
Description

Will find all the near stations around your location.

Returns

x_near, y_near, z_near, activ_near_id: as array - activ_near_id as list
